Question: In doing so, another mine was set off, killing three and wounding this person's artillery officer.
Hints: This person was named deputy commander of the invasion at the last minute, leaving him with little say in the planning.
In November 1988, this person was named commander of United States Central Command (CENTCOM), succeeding General George B Crist.
In 1992, this person published a memoir, It Doesn't Take a Hero, about his life; it became a bestseller.
